title: Why I still blog after 15 years
dot:
digraph BlogRetrospective{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box, style="rounded,filled", fontcolor=white, fillcolor=lightblue];BlogRetrospective[label="15 Years of Blogging" shape=ellipse fillcolor=darkblue fontcolor=white];StartBlog[label="Why I Started the Blog
- Create fast game prototypes
- Document progress
- Avoid Game Engine Trap"];ContinueBlog[label="Why I Continue to Blog
1. Enjoy writing
2. Clarify thoughts
3. Improve quality
4. Document personal projects
5. Yearly reviews
6. Personal project development
7. Improve writing & development skills"];NoExternalFeedback[label="Motivations Aren't Dependent on External Feedback
- Writing for myself
- No statistics kept"];TechEvolution[label="Evolution of the Tech Stack
- PHP -> Perl -> Static site (Jekyll) -> Haskell (Hakyll) -> CSS & Neovim integration"];FocusChange[label="Change in Focus
- Posts have grown larger
- Shift from gaming to programming and personal projects"];Future[label="What Does the Future Bring?
- Uncertain
- Enjoy the journey"];BlogRetrospective->StartBlog;BlogRetrospective->ContinueBlog;BlogRetrospective->NoExternalFeedback;BlogRetrospective->TechEvolution;BlogRetrospective->FocusChange;BlogRetrospective->Future;{rank=same;StartBlog;ContinueBlog;}{rank=same;NoExternalFeedback;TechEvolution;}{rank=same;FocusChange;Future;}}

title: Rearchitecting: Redis to SQLite
dot:
digraph Wafris_Migration{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue];Background[label="Background: Wafris - Open-source Web App Firewall
Client using Redis (v1) -> Migrating to SQLite (v2)", shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightgreen]; Redis[label="Redis: Good at speed but problematic
in deployment and management", fillcolor=lightcoral];SQLite[label="SQLite: Faster with local data access,
less network latency, easier for users", fillcolor=lightcyan]; v1[label="v1 Client: Redis-based, Deployment Issues"];v2[label="v2 Client: SQLite-based, Solutions Implemented"]; TLDR[label="TL;DR: Understanding pros/cons:
Redis vs SQLite vs Traditional RDBMS", fillcolor=lightyellow]; Motivation[label="Motivation:
Ease of use for developers", fillcolor=lightyellow]; Transition[label="Transition Process:
Architecture Re-evaluation and Benchmarking", shape=rectangle, fillcolor=lightyellow];Result[label="Results:
~3x Speed Improvement with SQLite", shape=rectangle, fillcolor=lightyellow];Background->v1;Background->v2;Background->TLDR; v1->Redis;v2->SQLite;TLDR->Motivation;Motivation->Transition;Transition->Result;}

title: The lost language extensions of MetaWare's High C compiler (2023)
dot:
digraph HighCCompiler{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box];HighCCompiler[label="FM TOWNS High C Compiler" shape=ellipse];Features[label="Key Features" shape=rect];Underscores[label="Underscores in Numeric Literals
Readable numbers with underscores (e.g. 1_000_000)
Introduced in C23"];LabeledArgs[label="Labeled Arguments
Call functions with named parameters
Similar to Python's syntax"];CaseRanges[label="Case Ranges
Match ranges in switch statements
(Example: case 'A'..'Z')"];NestedFunctions[label="Nested Functions
Functions within functions
Supports nonlocal exits and closures"];Generators[label="Generators
Python-style coroutines in C
Yield values from functions"];HighCCompiler->Features;Features->Underscores;Features->LabeledArgs;Features->CaseRanges;Features->NestedFunctions;Features->Generators;Underscores->"First in C family to have this feature";LabeledArgs->"Not available in standard C/C++ yet";CaseRanges->"Inspired by Pascal";NestedFunctions->"More expressive than traditional C";Generators->"Syntax sugar over nested functions";}
